website_summaries.verdict: Buyers love the prong locking mechanism, although you should probably swap out the white buoy if you boat where there are white caps.
pros: Galvanized folding anchor comes with 40-foot line, marker buoy, and nylon storage bag
Prong locking mechanism works to keep it open when in use and closed when stored
cons: Some buyers had issues with the quality of the casting (nicks, imperfections)
The marker buoy is small and white, which means it may be difficult to find if you have to come back for it

customer_reviews.title: Kept my kayak locked in place
customer_reviews.text: I bought this anchor for my kayak after reading many reviews of this product as well as others. Just as others have mentioned, rigging the anchor for 'hang up' situations is important, as you don't have a lot of leverage from a kayak to free a stuck anchor. After following instructions on You Tube, and adding a 3' section of chain to the rode, I was ready to hit the water. In 15 mph winds and a steady current, the anchor held strong. It stowed compact, is easy to deploy, and works like you would expect. Note, on soft silty bottoms with oyster beds, you need to take care not to chaff the anchor line, this the chain.
customer_reviews.author: ITGeek

customer_reviews.title: A really smart anchor.
customer_reviews.text: This 3.5 lb. anchor holds my 10' kayak, plus another kayak teathered to my kayak, rather well. no drift, no current movement, just a very reliable anchor. the other features i like about the design of the anchor is the locking mechanism for the prongs. the device locks the prongs in place while in the bag and locks the prongs in a spread-out position when in the water. very simple but very effective. A real convenience to have. i recommend this anchor to anybody who has a small craft (where a 3.5 lb. anchor is sufficient). Quick ship via Prime and comes with a strong nylon bag, plus 40 ft, of nylon braid. ya can't beat a deal like this.
customer_reviews.author: robert eckelkamp

customer_reviews.title: Purchased it for my paddle board when I would like to be stationary for longer period of time
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for my paddle board when I would like to be stationary for longer period of time. For example when my friends and I watched Jaws on our boards in the bay. Per a larger anchor manufacturers YouTube video, I've added about 4 feet of chain to the line. I also recommend buying a mason twine with a winder. Replace the twine with a 4" long 1" pvc pipe and wind the anchor rope onto it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Csuri

customer_reviews.title: Didn't take it out to the water yet but looks like it will do just fine
customer_reviews.text: Arrive on time and as described. Didn't take it out to the water yet but looks like it will do just fine
customer_reviews.author: yossi harbon

customer_reviews.title: Must own for a kayak fisherman
customer_reviews.text: This anchor works great. It comes with a ton of rope. Too much really. The only complaint is the bouy that it comes with, its small and white. The purpose of the bouy is in case you have to detach and come back for the anchor. This bouy gets lost in the water especially if there is any white capping. Other than that it works great. I have used it exclusively in saltwater. Works great on sandy bottom, grassy, rocky all the same. Everything fits in the bag nicely. Must own for a kayak fisherman
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mojica

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor, will not buy this style again.
customer_reviews.text: Great little anchor. Bought it to go kayak fishing on the river. Does a great job of keeping the boat stationary even in moderate current/flow. Second time I brought it out it hooked onto what I can only guess was a massive branch or root at the bottom. Boat didn’t move. Unfortunately due to the unforgiving grappling hook design, and despite my use of a zip tie at the top and the rope tied to the bottom per the recommendations of many, it simply wouldn’t come loose, so I ended up having to cut rope and count it as a loss. I’ll be switching to a mushroom style anchor for my next purchase due to this experience.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Nice Anchor for my Kayak
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy, solid and has a very nice rope, float and bag. I haven't used it yet so I will update later. But so far, I am very pleased and would recommend. Update 7/02/2017 - I have since used the anchor twice. It works beautifully. I am very pleased with the anchor. Works great with my Kayak and I am able to fish more comfortably now. Its light weight, but yet holds me and my Kayak in place. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Charlene M. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor for inflatable boat
customer_reviews.text: I have an inflatable Intex boat and this anchor is perfect. Not too light, not too heavy. Locks all four "fingers" open by use of the sliding ring with slots. Rope is good quality. Shipping is fast and storage bag is very handy. Edges are smooth enough to not worry about punctures.
customer_reviews.author: CheapGeek

customer_reviews.title: It's really is BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this anchor to use with my paddle board and I love it. Works exactly as described and I'm very happy with the purchase. Lightweight enough to have on the board and heavy enough to anchor in flat water sections on the river.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Anchor
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these as my wife and i like to fish from our regular sit in kayaks and on breezy days, its nice to drop the anchor and avoid drifting everywhere. Their are light, portable and come in a nice carry bag. The rope the comes with it is like 45 feet long so its a bit much sometimes when you are in shallow areas and I have a knot in it to shorten it up when needed. The points on the anchor can lock in the open and closed position so it wont fold up on you on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Erika M

customer_reviews.title: Great little anchor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace on that is now at the bottom of a lake in southern Iowa - there's a great story behind it. But the new anchor is great. I ordered it a few days before a planned Saturday trip and it delivered in plenty of time. I use the anchor to hold my 14 foot canoe in relatively still water while fishing. It does the job! It kept my canoe in place in about 25' of water as fishing and pontoon boats passed by. I recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Tie your own knot!!!!!! Anchor lost. :(
customer_reviews.text: I used this one time before it came loose and the anchor was lost. Dropped it in the water, pulled it up to move to another location. Dropped it in the water again, started fishing and noticed myself drifting down the river. The Anchor came loose and is lost in the bottom of the river. I should have checked it before putting it in the second time but thought the supplier would have known how to tie an anchor knot. I'm giving it two stars because it seemed like it was a nice anchor until it was lost.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: but this one works perfectly fine for my kayak
customer_reviews.text: Never tested an different anchor before , but this one works perfectly fine for my kayak . I would recommend putting the rope at the bottom and using a small zip tie to the top of it so you can break the zip tie if you ever get it snagged , the knots on the rope must be redone. But the anchor it's self is an very good product and has held up so far , I would buy this again if I needed another
customer_reviews.author: Tmaxx

customer_reviews.title: Great Canoe Anchor
customer_reviews.text: Have taken this anchor out once and was very pleased with its performance. I use mine with a 17' canoe and it performed well holding us stationary in a mild river current. Have not used it enough to speak to its durability, but it appears well made and I expect it will last. The carrying bag is a nice touch, as it does not get a lot of use in my canoe, and the bag keeps it well stowed and compact until needed
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Anchor is good, rope condition is disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: The anchor itself seems perfectly fine and will work. The rope came frayed in a couple spots. The hole on the bottom of the anchor looks as if a metal loop or something similar should be there so the rope can be tied there to prevent the anchor being permanently stuck under a log or rock. If the rope is tied to the top hole then it will eventually get stuck with no way of retrieving it. Delivery was fast, the bag, rope float, and carabiner all seem sufficient. I will have to buy a new rope is I don't want my anchor permanently under water.
customer_reviews.author: JHud1

customer_reviews.title: it works awesome, but you want to try out that "zip ...
customer_reviews.text: it works awesome, but you want to try out that "zip tie" the rope to the bottom and tie off at the tip method. This is if you fish really gnarly stuff were it will hang up. if it's sand, you're fine (although it wont hurt). I've almost got it stuck in the river a couple times because it bites so good.
customer_reviews.author: ahornATX

customer_reviews.title: Instructions should be added on how to rig this anchor
customer_reviews.text: This anchor shouldn't be rigged as it is received. The rope should be tied to a clevis on the bottom of the anchor with a small nylon tie holding the rope to the top eye on the anchor so if it gets lodged it can be retrieved. If it is lodged you can pull it hard enough to break the nylon tie and then retrev it by the bottom which will release the anchor. These anchors work better if you use 3 or 4 foot of chain attached to the anchor and then the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Can be improved.
customer_reviews.text: I had another one is these from a different company, they used pcv buoy instead of some type of foam and the rope was double thickness, the hook was made of stainless steel when you'd one is aluminum. This one lacks all the mentioned above, but I used a better rope and hooks. The storage bag was also padded and soft on the inside and this one is not. More chances of doing damage to your belongings.
customer_reviews.author: Gergana Adamova

customer_reviews.title: It anchors well
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for my 3 person rubber raft. I was on a lake with sandy bottom and slight wind and it held in place very well for over an hour of fishing. Unfortunately. someone else liked it too, as when packing up late dusk, I left it on shore and didn't notice it in it's black bag. Someone else did though as when I returned early next morning it was gone. So I liked it enough to buy a replacement when I got home. It anchors easily and firmly.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy G

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14' Sun Dolphin Scout Elite SS canoe w/30 lb Minn Kota motor and the anchor will hold in a pretty steady wind as long as there is something on the bottom of the lake/river to grab onto. Nice to be the only one on a lake that's not having to constantly maneuver around, because I have an anchor. :-)
customer_reviews.author: jefedelsol

customer_reviews.title: Nice small anchor formsmaller vessels - use as stern anchor when beached.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a secondary anchor for our 21ft boat when we go to the beach. I use the bow anchor to keep us from moving and this one to keep the stern from floating all around. That being said it does just an ok job at this. If you have a heavier boat I would suggest buying a heavier anchor for this set up. 3.5 lbs just doesn’t keep us from floating around as much as I’d prefer. Other than that it is a great quality anchor. I could see the rope giving way eventually but other than that it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product Great Company.
customer_reviews.text: Its very well made.. A great product for a great price. Receive a follow up e-mail from the supplier that is unheard of these days from any supplier. That tells me this company stands behind their product so there is no concern in purchasing this product. Truly a great product from a great company.
customer_reviews.author: John Feller

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE KAYAK GEAR
customer_reviews.text: If you are on the fence if you need an anchor like this one, YOU DO! First day out on the water bait fishing for catfish, it was windy. Was able to hook the anchor onto a submerged log and tied of to a branch. Kept me in play in 10-15mph wind and catch some catfish! Buy this or similar designs and rope length!
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Clip is NO GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: The anchor works great, just not sure who thought it would be smart to use a steel clip. Got five uses in salt water and it was frozen. I did rinse after ever use but there are small areas that the salt gets into.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The best feature other than appropriate weight is the collapsable claws ...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of weight to hold my 61 lb hobie outback still in calm to light winds. The best feature other than appropriate weight is the collapsable claws that also lock in place open and closed. easy to stow for those few times you need to be still. if you are a still fisherman, then i would recommend one on the bow and another stern. the price is low enough for two.
customer_reviews.author: Phylip Peltier

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this anchor! Can’t find anything wrong with it lol... I have used it several times on my SUP...works perfectly! The rope doesn’t get tangled, the anchor stays open with the locking mechanism and closed with it also. The locking mechanism does slide around some (making it unlock) but I think it’s meant to do that so if you get your anchor stuck in the water it will “eventually” close itself (which is an added bonus-hasn’t happened to me but pretty sure that’s what it is for)
customer_reviews.author: Love Amzn

customer_reviews.title: High quality, could use a clip instead of S hook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I like that it holds well for my kayak and is still easy to pull back up to the boat. The S hook should be a clip or caribineer, because it is sharp and for my purposes would not attach to anything, so I tie a knot each time. Pros: holds well, easy to maneuver, the prongs are not sharp around the edges. Carrying pouch is superb, lots of rope Cons: S-hook is useless, buoy came dented, collar is cumbersome and slips a lot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good for lake use
customer_reviews.text: We live in a lake community and have two medium adult kayaks and a kids kayak. Today, I threw anchor and then my husband and daughter paddled up to me and we held onto each other’s boats. It was a little windy, but the anchor held just fine. I cannot speak for river conditions, but I am super pleased with this anchor. It’s nice and light, has ample rope, and works as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: RatherBeCamping

customer_reviews.title: BEST Marine and Outdoors kayak anchor
customer_reviews.text: When i received the anchor my first impression of it was that i was really happy for what i was getting for the money. Although i havent been able to use it yet do to the fact that i forgot it on my last trip out on the water, theres no doubt in my mind that it will preform as suspected. It looks to be well made and feels pretty sturdy and i would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good anchor for your kayak or small boat.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: well constructed and it does a nice job of holding my kayak in place while I ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this anchor for my fishing kayak. It's a solid anchor, well constructed and it does a nice job of holding my kayak in place while I fish. I caught a 7 pounder a few weeks ago and was concerned that the fish would pull the kayak around a little but that didn't happen. The rope is plenty long and it even came with a clip to attach it to the side of the boat and a carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brew Time

customer_reviews.title: Ordering a second one! Great service and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Now I'll be ordering another to update the old smaller anchor in the second of two kayaks we fish from. Hubby drifted way beyond the area we were fishing in and I stayed right where I set the anchor. Just right for the 13' fishing kayaks we use. Well made and great service from supplier. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Terry R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kayak anchor!
customer_reviews.text: We use this for two inflatable kayaks lashed together, along with a paddleboard, all on a single 3lb anchor. It holds well, and the foldable & portable design is great. We've mostly used it in lakes with rocky or silty floors, but it also worked perfectly on a calm ocean day with a sandy floor. It slips a little bit on windy days but that's to be expected. Just make sure you get enough rope for your depth. At least a 3:1 ratio is ideal, so the anchor can grip the floor sideways. You'll need more line for windier conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: Using this on my 12ft hobie and works great. The bag and release carabiner are very nice. The float is a little small and may be hard to see depending on conditions. I may spray paint it to help. Good anchor set up for a kayak
customer_reviews.author: lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Will be buying one for my personal use ...
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what my husband wanted for his kayak for fishing. It lodges in the sand, rocks and muck, but doesn't get stuck and isn't difficult to pull free. Perfect. Will be buying one for my personal use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Audra - Indianapolis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little anchor
customer_reviews.text: This anchor works way better than expected. I use my kayak on the Colorado River (current speeds 8-12MPH) and if holds every time. Opens and collapses with ease. Locks into place and securely fits in included storage bag. Perfect little anchor!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Holds my kayak steady in fairly brisk wind. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds my kayak steady in fairly brisk wind. I do a lot of freshwater fishing and kayaking. Recently had it in a small lake, in the windiest conditions I've been in yet, and it performed well. My only complaint is that I didn't buy two in order to keep from rotating around the anchor in the wind. Might end up buying a second for the stern.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: cheap bag
customer_reviews.text: The bag is cheap and the bottom seam was open ripped. Ill sew it shut and fix it. I wish the bag was better....
customer_reviews.author: R1rider

customer_reviews.title: Expectations met
customer_reviews.text: I took a bit of a chance in buying this anchor as, at the time of my purchase, there were no reviews for it. I liked that it was galvanized, it came with plenty of line and a nylon bag. I use this anchor with a fishing kayak primarily on a slower moving river in northern Michigan. The anchor seems to be well designed and made. There is a sliding locking-collar to keep the flukes retracted or deployed. It works as expected for me.
customer_reviews.author: Zvolts

customer_reviews.title: Only OK
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. Casting is pretty rough, steel hook not as good as clip, collar fit is very sloppy when anchor blades are extended. From the description, expected better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Good Business

customer_reviews.title: appropriate for use
customer_reviews.text: using for 13' fishing kayak. Have taken out once. Worked well in light wind. Plenty of line for much deeper water. Will have time to try under much more stressful conditions. Will update if find any flaws,
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L Pilgreen

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a solid product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the chance to use this anchor yet but it did come to me quickly and as described. It appears to be of high quality, functions well (folds up and deploys smoothly; locks in place; etc.) and comes with a durable stprage bag. I expect it will perform well but I'll try and update this review after using this item.
customer_reviews.author: chilemery

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Kayak or SUP
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I live in MO and fish the Meramec river from my kayak. I keep this in the forward dry compartment until I find my spot and drop it over the side. I have it tied up so that I can fish without the current sending me to short or 10 miles downstream. It's well made and portable and perfect for a kayak or a SUP.
customer_reviews.author: RayBran

customer_reviews.title: Small easily stored
customer_reviews.text: Unit works well. Had to modify unit by adding a line thimble to the anchor connection to prevent the rope from chaffing. Otherwise a great unit for small boat.
customer_reviews.author: Steel 1

customer_reviews.title: Good value and design
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and as described. Have not had a chance to use them but the fit well into the kayak storage compartment and came in a useful storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: better made than the one at Walmart
customer_reviews.text: better made than the one at Walmart, and the same price. Consider tying the rope to the bottom of the anchor, and put a ziptie from rope to top, if it gets stuck in a rock a hard pull will break the tie, and the rope may then drag the anchor out backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Schultze

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Kayak
customer_reviews.text: The anchor came in a great bag, but that is only dressing - but nice to have to store things. The anchor is strong small and easy to open. The rope is tough and I can't wait to use it up here in the muddy waters of the Charles River. It fits nicely into my 11' Kayak. Now I need to get one for my wife. ADDED, I got one for my wife and they work well and are great.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect anchor for waverunner
customer_reviews.text: I have a Yamaha wave runner...fits perfect in my storage compartment.....Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Holds tightly and folds nicely!
customer_reviews.text: Held my 10ft inflatable and a tethered kayak in place in a bit of wind and chop, just great! Folds up neatly and the length of rope included is great.
customer_reviews.author: TA_SEA-GEG

customer_reviews.title: the customer service from BEST Marine & Outdoors was excellent
customer_reviews.text: First off, the customer service from BEST Marine & Outdoors was excellent! I have never been personally contacted by a business regarding its product. The owner wrote a personalized email and recommended some tips and advice on how to use the anchor. As well as an assurance if the product had faults or did not meet my expectation that he was going to personally take care of it. As for the product, it does what it is supposed to do. The rope it came with has plenty of length and I think it great that everything fits in the carrying case it came with. So far, I would recommend the anchor for the price and its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Neonee Senoro

customer_reviews.title: Quicker and smaller release of anchor advised
customer_reviews.text: A great product that competes with its competitors. One thing I can advise is the evolution of the anchor, being able to grab anchor at closer ranges, and smaller release of rope. Reason being is that my kayak had a hard time anchoring on a slow moving river.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Work Great. Fits perfectly into the Waverunner hold below the ...
customer_reviews.text: Work Great. Fits perfectly into the Waverunner hold below the seat. The only improvement would be something like a "slip knot" type of device because I never use the entire rope to hold the Waverunner off of the shore and end up tying a temp. knot to shorten the line.
customer_reviews.author: C Farmer

customer_reviews.title: This is the "Best" kayak anchor
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Sun Dolphin Journey 12 SS. I installed an anchor trolley and this works great with it. The line is high quality and long enough to give me a good angle for for a solid hold. Float included so you can recover it after a quick disconnect.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Nice anchor.
customer_reviews.text: Nice anchor. The rope is terrible for an anchor. It twists and gets knotted up easily so its aggravating when changing depths. I replace rope with a good anchor rope.
customer_reviews.author: RDAIV

customer_reviews.title: I must have missed what the anchor is made of..
customer_reviews.text: What is the anchor made of? It's the same anchor as the cheaper versions. Still a great easy to use anchor. We have SUPs and kayaks and want to floating without drift. First use was great with no wind. Second was against the wind, with a little drag. Overall a decent anchor.
customer_reviews.author: ALLTOOWELL

customer_reviews.title: SO good I need another one
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this product is so great. I mean it anchored where I wanted it to...Definitely buying again, in like 5 minutes because on my first trip, after I used it, I flipped my kayak and apparently didn't have it tethered appropriately and it's somewhere in the bottom of the river. So, round 2.
customer_reviews.author: B C.

customer_reviews.title: terrible grappling hook!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to climb a building and ended up breaking the 2nd story window. Do not USE AS A GRAPPLING HOOK fYI
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Sheppardini

customer_reviews.title: it is durable and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the anchor to secure the rear end of my 6,000 lb 22' Dual Console. When we beach/anchor the boat in the summer time, this helps to keep the rear facing the way we want it. it is durable and works great.
customer_reviews.author: PRIMUS LC

customer_reviews.title: Anger at this anchor
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what good an achor is if it can’t hold a wave runner in place with light waves in 15mph wind and a sandy bottom 3’ deep. Didn’t even pretend to do the job. Might work for light current but go bigger if you have waves to contend with.
customer_reviews.author: Schug

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Had such high reviews but completely didn't live ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Had such high reviews but completely didn't live up to the hype. Pros: No longer has a s hook, instead they replaced it with a carabiner. Anchor seems to be solid (didn't have a chance to test because I will be returning it.) Cons: Cheap buoy. Rope came frayed out of the box. I think there are better options out there. Hopefully the rope fray shows up on the camera because it looks very bad. The anchor itself looks fine, everything else is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Charliemac10

customer_reviews.title: Good anchor.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the float. material is styrofoam, won't last long, thought I was getting a plastic float of some kind.
customer_reviews.author: Larry F.

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor for small watercraft
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a kayak that has an out rigger. Even when the wind comes up the anchor still holds steady. I also like the way it folds up nicely into a bag to stay compact. Highly recommend this anchor for small water crafts...
customer_reviews.author: Chile'

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This anchor worked great with my kayak this past weekend. Very windy day on the lake and it did the job. Even tied my daughter's kayak off to my boat and it held us both in place.
customer_reviews.author: TMJ

customer_reviews.title: does as should
customer_reviews.text: great anchor, I use it on my kayak/anchor trolley system. Have not dropped it with claws out due to the areas I'm in. I have got snagged a couple of time, but it ends up coming up fine once you get directly over it, or bypass the opposite side. I give four stars b/c the mechanism to let the claws out is harder than it should be, on mine at least
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works PERFECT!!!!! I couldn't be happier. For reference, I use this with my Lifetime Tamarack 100 Angler Kayak
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Good kayak kit
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than I could find it anywhere else. I run a piece of chain to the shank w/ nylon to pull if it gets stuck, cheaper than replacing anchors
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Great ancor
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to hook up 2 kayaks in steady 8 knot winds and coastal tide and we stayed in place
customer_reviews.author: Wahlyworld

customer_reviews.title: Easily set up for zip tie
customer_reviews.text: Well made item. Easily set up for zip tie. Looking forward to kayaking weather.
customer_reviews.author: bob enerson

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: Would give a better review but when I opened my package I noticed that my anchor would not open as I took a closer look I saw that one one of the anchors that are supposed to fold out has gotten bent and forced around the center piece of the anchor making the anchor unable to open
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: it is a great product.
customer_reviews.text: It works but after reading all the reviews before buying I believed this is what i needed for my Kayak. This anchor is to heavy for the river. shoudl of went with something that weighed less. As for the anchor itself, it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: open on dry land before using, anchor is not attached to rope.
customer_reviews.text: looked great, wish it was attached to the rope when i received it, opened the bag while on my kayak, it slipped right into the water and down to the bottom of the bay. i was left holding the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold jet ski in place
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for me. I was disappointed, that it did not hold my ski in place. It’s just not strong enough. 2019 rxt-x Seadoo.
customer_reviews.author: rideabiketoday

customer_reviews.title: Effective at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything - storage case, light weight and expedient service.
customer_reviews.author: Walter S Howerton

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: We got it for our small rubber boat, perfect! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Max Shumsky

customer_reviews.title: Great anchor very strong
customer_reviews.text: Anchor held in in place even w in th strong winda creating waces due to horricane florence in north Carolina. The only thing ih s the rope got caught in my hooks. I will be cganging for snall diameter
customer_reviews.author: J. adames

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lightweight water craft.
customer_reviews.text: The anchors did exactly what they are suppose to do. The only problem that I have is that for my purposes they are a bit too light. I have a 9-ft. pontoon boat for fishing and in a stiff breeze I tend to "drag my anchor". I probably should have gotten a 5-8 lb. That said, this is a great anchor for small fishing craft, such as I have.
customer_reviews.author: John P Boblett

customer_reviews.title: Title says "best", does not lie
customer_reviews.text: Comes with a 40 foot tether; perfect for all the open water locations near me (Midwest). Comes with a bag, float, and carabiner. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Naish Jr

customer_reviews.title: poor value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I expected a better line and buoy. had to replace both.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID G.

customer_reviews.title: Well Named!
customer_reviews.text: I use this anchor kit with a 12 foot sit on top fishing kayak and it is perfect for my needs. The anchor is very well designed and is capable of anchoring my kayak in fairly windy conditions. The storage bag is sized large enough to contain anchor and line. The line is long enough for anywhere I fish and a comfortable handling diameter. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kayak anchor!
customer_reviews.text: Great little anchor for my kayak. It's almost 'self-contained' being it closes up 'into itself'. Hardly takes up any room on the kayak, but it holds it steady very well. I would definitely recommend this anchor
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lazaro

customer_reviews.title: Great little anchor
customer_reviews.text: Anchor kept little inflatable boat in place in the middle of the lake over night and half the day. Love that it folds up when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: The stuff inside the bag is great the bag no so much
customer_reviews.text: The Bag that holds the the anchor and rode and float immediately tore apart when I attempted to put the anchor back in it. The bottom seam is now gone and I have to sew it or find a new bag. THIS HAPPENED ON FIRST USE.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Deveaux

customer_reviews.title: A great product!
customer_reviews.text: We custom make tiny boats and this is just perfect for the space we have. It is both very functional and very compactable.
customer_reviews.author: K Shriver

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Function bag line all of it was perfect Held my 15’ flatback canoe with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Simpson Gittleman

customer_reviews.title: Good Kayak Anchor
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for light weight and compact designed well and should work great with my 16 foot fishing kayak. Have not used yet, but see no problems.
customer_reviews.author: AKfireman

customer_reviews.title: This worked really well for a kayak on a slow ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well for a kayak on a slow moving section of the Delaware River. I was able to stay in the middle of the river and fish some deeper water that I normally can't get a line into. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: brian s

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Purchase.  Great Stern Anchor for Lowe 1257.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Good quality product. Using with cam lock for stern anchor on 12’ aluminum boat.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Freese

customer_reviews.title: The Anchor works great.
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 Hobie Kayaks--13 footers and we ordered just one anchor to see how they work...we love it and are getting another one today. The Owners of the Company did a personal follow-up, great Service!
customer_reviews.author: James M. Rexroat

customer_reviews.title: They fold up small and are easily stowed.
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for my Jetski and was half the price of similar ones from my local boat shop. They fold up small and are easily stowed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable anchor
customer_reviews.text: My first anchor actually wouldn't open. The retainer was stuck shut. Amazon sent me a new one which works great. I wouldn't call it light - I guess thats the idea! Its 3 lbs as advertised and works great on my SUP.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Malina

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but looks like good quality and a great value
customer_reviews.author: Thurlow

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Gift to grandson for his inflatable kayak. He loves it,
customer_reviews.author: D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: nice product, compact
customer_reviews.text: nice product, compact, works great for coastal fishing in marshes where I need to sit in a tidal channel... I use it both for a 15' Wilderness tandem and a 10' rec kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size/weight for my kayak!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great anchor for a kayak (or canoe). Perfect size fits into my kayak hatch and the weight is just right for keeping the boat situated while fishing in the lake or slow moving sections of a river.
customer_reviews.author: Twardy

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak anchor
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping. Arrived ahead of schedule. Used it as soon as it came in and we love it. Works perfectly fishing in our kayak. Allows us to stay put and no drifting at all. Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Banx and Tilley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Anchor
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a kayak or canoe. Absolutely does the job. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Won’t be able to try it for a few months but looks like it will do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality light duty anchor. Came as advertised, on time and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Robert Ringlee

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra price.
customer_reviews.text: I was considering an anchor without the rope, bag, or float that cost less, but went with this item. Glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: John Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Expected better, but it will do the job
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality for the price. Expected better, but it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: dosfam

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY PRODUCT AND EXCELLENT SERVICE!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Not only is this a quality item and easy to use, the customer service IS AMAZING! If you are thinking about buying this, I hope this review helps you to pick this one! This company is EXCELLENT with ensuring your satisfaction. BUY THIS ONE! 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: anna k.

product_meta.title: Best Marine Kayak Anchor with 40ft Rope. Premium 3.5lb Folding Anchor Accessories for Fishing Kayaks, Canoe, Jet Ski, SUP Paddle Board and Small Boats. Grapnel Anchors Trolley Kit Accessory
feature_bullets: HOW ARE WE DIFFERENT? - Our anchors are made of rust resistant galvanized iron and include an extra long 40ft marine grade rope, a nylon storage bag, a buoy ball and a stainless steel carabiner clip. Each anchor weighs 3.5lbs (1.6kg) and can easily be stored in kayaks, canoes, jet skis, SUP paddle boards and small boats

WHY BEST MARINE AND OUTDOORS? - Our company goal and mission is to help people find inner peace and purpose through kayaking and boating. Our anchor allows you to stop, connect with nature and soak in its surrounding beauty

WHO IS OUR ANCHOR FOR? - Spending time on the water is the perfect opportunity to get away and relax. Our anchor is the ideal accessory for outdoor enthusiasts who are into fishing, meditation, watching sunsets or photography

HOW DOES IT WORK? - Slide the anchor collar upwards, fold open the 4 flukes, slide the collar back down, and lock into position. Use as much anchor rope as possible to create better horizontal drag on the bottom surface. The perfect anchor for trolley kits!

WHO ARE WE? - Located in Massachusetts, BEST Marine & Outdoors is a leading provider of kayak accessories in the USA, Europe and Australia. We stand behind our products and offer complete customer service and satisfaction
